item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/10/22/live-concert-opportunities/#comment-4105">Anthony</a>.
I brought it up mostly to pre-empt the argument. I suspect many bands would continue to do fine selling concert tickets and the recordings afterwards.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Anthony.

I brought it up mostly to pre-empt the argument. I suspect many bands would continue to do fine selling concert tickets and the recordings afterwards.

item.title: By: Anthony
item.dc:creator: Anthony
item.description:
<blockquote>There may be a fear that selling recordings of the concert will reduce ticket sales.</blockquote>
Pearl Jam has offered/sold recordings of all their live shows ('bootlegs') for many years, and they're still selling out arenas. And I've purchased over 20 of those recordings and will still shell out $200+ every single time they come to town. Every artist in the world should be doing this.
item.content:encoded:
There may be a fear that selling recordings of the concert will reduce ticket sales.

Pearl Jam has offered/sold recordings of all their live shows (‘bootlegs’) for many years, and they’re still selling out arenas. And I’ve purchased over 20 of those recordings and will still shell out $200+ every single time they come to town. Every artist in the world should be doing this.
